meanings.definition: A person who owns land or property outright.
meanings.sent1: The freeholders in our town take care of their properties with pride.
meanings.sent2: The freeholders gathered to discuss the maintenance of the community park.
meanings.sent3: The freeholders had a friendly competition to see who could grow the tallest sunflower.
meanings.sent4: The freeholders were the pillars of the neighborhood, holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The freeholders were like kings of their own little kingdoms, ruling over their lands.

meanings.definition: The collective body of people who own land or property in a particular area.
meanings.sent1: All the freeholders in the village came together for a meeting.
meanings.sent2: The freeholders voted on the new regulations for property maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The freeholders organized a potluck to strengthen their community bonds.
meanings.sent4: The freeholders formed a strong alliance to protect their shared interests.
meanings.sent5: The freeholders stood united, each contributing to the prosperity of the region.
